data.proposal:
# 5-Day Madrid Itinerary

## Overview
Begin with a brief overview of what makes this trip special. The total budget is approximately $5000. This plan is for couple traveler(s). No specific interests mentioned.

## Day 1

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Café Central (Calle de Ferraz, 2) with a classic Spanish breakfast
- Visit the Royal Palace of Madrid (Plaza de la Armería, s/n), estimated duration 2 hours
- Travel time: 10 minutes from Café Central to Plaza de la Armería
- Afternoon activity at the Prado Museum (Calle de Felipe IV, s/n), estimated duration 3 hours
- Lunch recommendation at Botín Restaurant (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 9) with traditional Spanish cuisine
- Travel time: 10 minutes from Prado Museum to Botín Restaurant

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Visit the Retiro Park (Paseo del Prado, s/n), estimated duration 2 hours
- Lunch recommendation at El Qu Jetcho (Calle de Alcalá, 43) with modern Spanish cuisine
- Travel time: 10 minutes from Retiro Park to El Qu Jetcho

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at Casa Mono (Calle de la Ballesta, 6), recommended for contemporary Spanish cuisine
- Visit the Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor areas
- Travel time: 5 minutes from Casa Mono to Puerta del Sol

## Day 2

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Chocolatería San Ginés (Calle de la Ballesta, 6) with a traditional Spanish breakfast and coffee
- Visit the Reina Sofia Museum (Calle de Santa Isabel, s/n), estimated duration 2 hours
- Lunch recommendation at La Latina Market (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 9), try local tapas and cuisine

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Visit the Thyssen-Bornemisza National Museum (Paseo del Prado, s/n), estimated duration 3 hours
- Travel time: 10 minutes from Reina Sofia Museum to Thyssen-Bornemisza National Museum

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at El Prior (Calle de la Ballesta, 6) with modern Spanish cuisine
- Visit the Malasaña neighborhood and its street art scene
- Travel time: 5 minutes from El Prior to Malasaña neighborhood

## Day 3

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Conde del Moral (Calle de Ferraz, 2) with a traditional Spanish breakfast and coffee
- Visit the Royal Botanical Garden (Calle de Alcalá, s/n), estimated duration 2 hours
- Travel time: 10 minutes from Conde del Moral to Royal Botanical Garden

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch recommendation at La Tasquita de Enfrente (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 9) with traditional Spanish cuisine
- Visit the Debod Temple (Avenida de María Luisa, s/n), estimated duration 2 hours

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at El Rastro Market (Calle de la Ballesta, 6) with local tapas and cuisine
- Explore the lively nightlife of the city center

## Day 4

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Café Gijón (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 9) with a traditional Spanish breakfast and coffee
- Visit the San Fernando Royal Academy of Fine Arts (Calle de Ferraz, s/n), estimated duration 2 hours

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch recommendation at El Carmen Market (Calle de Alcalá, 43) with modern Spanish cuisine
- Visit the Segovia Aqueduct Park (Parque del Acueducto, s/n), estimated duration 2 hours

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at Casa Alberto (Calle de la Ballesta, 6) with contemporary Spanish cuisine
- Enjoy a flamenco show in the Flamenca tablao area

## Day 5

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Chocolatería San Ginés (Calle de la Ballesta, 6) with a traditional Spanish breakfast and coffee
- Visit the National Archaeological Museum (Plaza de las Vizcaínas, s/n), estimated duration 3 hours

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch recommendation at Botín Restaurant (Calle de los Cuchilleros, 9) with traditional Spanish cuisine
- Visit the Mercado San Miguel (Plaza de San Miguel, s/n), estimated duration 2 hours

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Farewell dinner at El Prior (Calle de la Ballesta, 6) with modern Spanish cuisine
- Travel back to accommodations for departure

## Practical Information

### Recommended Accommodations
- Hotel Palacio del Conde (Calle de Ferraz, s/n), a luxurious boutique hotel in the heart of the city ($250 per night)
- Hotel NH Collection Madrid Grand Mercado (Plaza Mayor, s/n), a modern and comfortable hotel with great views of the city center ($180 per night)
- Hostal Casa Morisca (Calle de la Ballesta, 6), a cozy and affordable hostel in a lively neighborhood ($60 per night)

### Transportation Options
- Public transportation: Metro lines 1, 2, 3, 5, and C, as well as buses number 14, 27, 34, 37, 45, 49, 52, 54, 57, 59, and 61.
- Taxi fares around $10-$15 to most destinations.

### Estimated Costs
- Accommodations: $250 (Hotel Palacio del Conde) + $180 (Hotel NH Collection Madrid Grand Mercado) + $60 (Hostal Casa Morisca) = $490 total for 5 nights
- Transportation: $30 per day x 5 days = $150 total
- Food and drink: $200 per person x 2 people x 5 days = $2000 total
- Attractions and activities: $300 total (estimated)

Total estimated cost for the trip: $4940

Please note that this is just an estimate, and actual costs may vary based on individual preferences and exchange rates.
